title: Space Force awards $45 million to universities for propulsion and power research
summary: To date the Space Force has invested more than $100 million in its University Consortium initiative

title: Investigation Identifies Cause of Ariane 6 APU Anomaly
summary: An Ariane 6 Launcher Task Force update has identified exceeded temperature limits as the cause of an APU anomaly during the rocket’s inaugural flight. Europe’s Ariane 6 rocket was launched for the first time on 9 July 2024 from the Guiana Space Centre. While the initial phase of the flight was completed as expected, an […]

title: NASA Veteran Kevin McCormick Joins Desert Works Propulsion as Senior Master Technician

title: Software fix planned to correct Ariane 6 upper stage issue
summary: European officials say a software change should correct a problem on the inaugural Ariane 6 launch in July that prevented the rocket’s upper stage from performing a final maneuver.

title: 55 Years Ago: Space Task Group Proposes Post-Apollo Plan to President Nixon
summary: The Apollo 11 mission in July 1969 completed the goal set by President John F. Kennedy in 1961 to land a man on the Moon and return him safely to the Earth before the end of the decade.
